messages.subject: Re: A change of direction ...
messages.msgSnippet: Jim Thank you again for your erudite comments on the kodzuka; as always, they were very gratefully received. Jim, the very last thing that I had intended in my
messages.messageBody:
Jim

Thank you again for your erudite comments on the kodzuka; as always,
they were very gratefully received.

Jim, the very last thing that I had intended in my intemperate
comments regarding the message board was any personal criticism of
you, although I now accept that it must have appeared so. Rather
was it intended as a rebuke to many of the other members who do not
share your dedicated and serious approach to the project.

Regards, John L.

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@E...>
wrote:
> John,
> The fault is largely mine since a) I have not had a lot of time to
work on the list, and b) as Rich mentioned people may be reluctant
to post opinions that I may later contradict.
>
> What to do... bug the hell out of me until I answer, but more
importantly everyone should reply with what he thinks without
worry.
>
> I'm interested in all ideas to improve things.
>
> Jim
>
>
>
>
> Dear members
>
> Surely I am not alone in bemoaning the apparent demise of this
> Nihontostudy group? Once a vibrant and educational medium for
many
> people sharing our interest, it is now a shadow of its former
self.
> Messages are posted far less frequently, and often remain
unanswered.
> Those that are answered seem to produce a rash of self-indulgent
> repartee between a few, select members which the remainder of us
find
> unamusing and tedious.
>
> Is there any hope of a change of direction in order to restore
this
> message board to its early promise?
>
> JPL.
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] A change of direction ...
messages.msgSnippet: John, The fault is largely mine since a) I have not had a lot of time to work on the list, and b) as Rich mentioned people may be reluctant to post opinions
messages.messageBody:
John,
The fault is largely mine since a) I have not had a lot of time to work on the list, and b) as Rich mentioned people may be reluctant to post opinions that I may later contradict.

What to do... bug the hell out of me until I answer, but more importantly everyone should reply with what he thinks without worry.

I'm interested in all ideas to improve things.

Jim




Dear members

Surely I am not alone in bemoaning the apparent demise of this
Nihontostudy group? Once a vibrant and educational medium for many
people sharing our interest, it is now a shadow of its former self.
Messages are posted far less frequently, and often remain unanswered.
Those that are answered seem to produce a rash of self-indulgent
repartee between a few, select members which the remainder of us find
unamusing and tedious.

Is there any hope of a change of direction in order to restore this
message board to its early promise?

JPL.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] A change of direction ...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All,               I can only echo RT s letter.  As a complete neophyte,  any questions I ve had have always been answered in a timely
messages.messageBody:
Hi All,
������������� I can only echo RT's letter.� As a complete neophyte,� any
questions I've had have always been answered in a timely fashion. Most often
the same day. This group has been a tremendous help to me in my quest for
information as I do not live in a Nihonto rich enviroment. And for that, I
am greatful to you all.�
�
Mark Jaillet
�

-----Original Message-----
From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com]On
Behalf Of Richard Turner
Sent: Wednesday, September 28, 2005 7:57 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] A change of direction ...


Hi John, I find all the groups go through quiet periods. I also find
that whenever I post a question here, they are answered in time. It may
take a few days or sometimes a week but I seem to get my answers. I
guess it depends on how busy people are. I know Jim is very busy a lot
of the time. I also think a lot of folk feel they are better off not
saying anything at all rather than answering with uncertainty and that
may be why questions go answered.

Just some thoughts.

Richard Turner

messages.messageBody:
Dear Richard

Thank you for your observation re my 'bouncing' status. In fact
this membership has been discontinued, since I stupidly 'signed in'
twice when I first joined. My extant address appears to OK.

Regards, John.

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] A change of direction ...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi John, I find all the groups go through quiet periods. I also find that whenever I post a question here, they are answered in time. It may take a few days or
messages.messageBody:
Hi John, I find all the groups go through quiet periods. I also find
that whenever I post a question here, they are answered in time. It may
take a few days or sometimes a week but I seem to get my answers. I
guess it depends on how busy people are. I know Jim is very busy a lot
of the time. I also think a lot of folk feel they are better off not
saying anything at all rather than answering with uncertainty and that
may be why questions go answered.

Just some thoughts.

Richard Turner

messages.subject: A change of direction ...
messages.msgSnippet: Dear members Surely I am not alone in bemoaning the apparent demise of this Nihontostudy group?  Once a vibrant and educational medium for many people sharing
messages.messageBody:
Dear members

Surely I am not alone in bemoaning the apparent demise of this
Nihontostudy group? Once a vibrant and educational medium for many
people sharing our interest, it is now a shadow of its former self.
Messages are posted far less frequently, and often remain unanswered.
Those that are answered seem to produce a rash of self-indulgent
repartee between a few, select members which the remainder of us find
unamusing and tedious.

Is there any hope of a change of direction in order to restore this
message board to its early promise?

JPL.
